1:
Why, Yahweh, do you stand far off?
\q Why do you hide yourself in times of trouble?
\q
3:
For the wicked person boasts of his deepest desires;
\q he blesses the greedy and insults Yahweh.
4:
The wicked man has a raised face; he does not seek God.
\q He never thinks about God because he does not care at all about him.
\q
7:
His mouth is full of cursing and deceptive, harmful words;
\q his tongue injures and destroys.
9:
He lurks in secret like a lion in the thicket;
\q he lies in wait to catch the oppressed.
\q He catches the oppressed when he pulls in his net.
\q
10:
His victims are crushed and beaten down;
\q they fall into his strong nets.
12:
Arise, Yahweh! Lift up your hand, God!
\q Do not forget the oppressed.
13:
Why does the wicked man reject God
\q and say in his heart, "You will not hold me accountable"?
\q
15:
Break the arm of the wicked and evil man.
\q Make him account for his evil deeds,
\q which he thought you would not discover.
\q
16:
Yahweh is King forever and ever;
\q the nations are driven out of his land.
18:
You defend the fatherless and the oppressed
\q so that no man on the earth will cause terror again.
